entry.title: South Africa Imposes Year-End Licensing Deadline For Crypto Exchanges
entry.summary:
In a move to regulate the fast-growing crypto industry, South Africa‚Äôs financial regulator, the Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA), has announced a year-end deadline for mandatory licensing of all crypto exchanges operating in the nation.
The impending regulatory change comes as an effort to mitigate the potential financial risks associated with crypto transactions for South African consumers. With this, South Africa, Africa‚Äôs most advanced economy, becomes the first in the continent to enforce such a licensing requirement.
The move underlines the nation‚Äôs ongoing commitment to keeping pace with the evolving digital landscape while ensuring a regulatory framework that can enhance consumer protection in the crypto space.
A Push For Licensed Operations

entry.title: Crypto Company Funding Takes A Hit: VC Investments Drop 70% in One Year ‚Äì Report
entry.summary:
Crypto sector investments are facing increasing hesitation from venture capitalists due to a combination of ongoing controversies, market volatility, and uncertain regulatory conditions.
As a result of these challenges, funding has decreased as investors exercise prudence and look for more secure investment options elsewhere.
A recent research from RootData, an established provider of digital asset analytics, claims that over the past year, venture capital investments in the cryptocurrency business have significantly decreased by more than 70%.
Market participants and industry watchers are concerned since this fall represents a significant change in the investment environment within the cryptocurrency sector.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC Edges Closer to Fresh 1-Year High Above $31,000
entry.summary:
Bitcoin moved back above the $31,000 level on July 4th, as U.S. traders celebrated the Independence Day holiday. As a result of the rally, the cryptocurrency remained near a one-year high in today‚Äôs session. Ethereum consolidated after Monday‚Äôs gains.
Bitcoin
Bitcoin (BTC) moved closer to a fresh one-year high on Tuesday, as U.S. markets closed in celebration of the July 4th holiday.
Following a low of $30,586.51 to start the week, BTC/USD raced to an intraday peak of $31,375.61 earlier in the session.
The move saw bitcoin edge closer to last Friday‚Äôs high at $31,443, which was its strongest point since June last year.
Earlier momentum has since faded, as the relative strength index (RSI) collided with a resistance level at 70.00.
The index is now tracking at 68.43 and appears to be heading for a support point at the 66.00 mark.
Should it reach this point, there is a strong possibility that bitcoin will be trading around the $30,500 level.
Ethereum
After moving towards $2,000 on Monday, ethereum (ETH) slipped in today‚Äôs session, falling below $1,950.
ETH/USD dropped to a bottom at $1,949.15 earlier in the day, less than 24 hours after peaking at $1,974.78.
The world‚Äôs second-largest cryptocurrency has since rebounded and is once again closing in on a multi-month high.
In order to get there, ETH bulls will need to take price strength above an upcoming ceiling at the 64.00 zone.
Currently, the RSI has a reading of 62.59, which is its highest level since April 19, when the price was above $2,100.
Some believe that ETH could head back toward this point in the coming weeks.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Will markets rally after U.S. traders return from the July 4th holiday? Leave your thoughts in the comments below.

How Ordinal Inscriptions Will Drive Adoption Of Bitcoin‚Äôs Lightning Network
entry.summary: This is an opinion editorial by Jesse Shrader, the co-founder and CEO of Amboss, a Lightning Network explorer and analytics tool. For years, you could basically only do two things on the Bitcoin network: You could save BTC or you could spend it. Then, a late 2021 privacy upgrade had the unintended consequence of allowing data storage on the Bitcoin blockchain, resulting in NFT-like inscriptions and BRC-20 tokens, both applying Ordinal Theory for asset tracking. The popularity of NFT-like Ordinal inscriptions and the experimental BRC-20 token standard has driven up transaction costs across the Bitcoin network. The frothy demand for ‚Äústamping‚Äù limited block space with new data pushed transaction costs so high that in May 2023, Binance twice had to pause BTC withdrawals, a risky and undesira‚Ä¶

Shiba Inu Traders In Deep Losses, Is A Rebound Coming Soon?
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows that Shiba Inu investors are currently in deep losses, something that may help the cryptocurrency turn itself around.
Shiba Inu MVRV Z-Score Has Been Highly Negative Recently
According to data from the on-chain analytics firm Santiment, Shiba Inu is seeing tremendous FUD at the moment. The relevant indicator here is the ‚ÄúMVRV Z-Score,‚Äù which provides us with hints about whether a given cryptocurrency is overvalued or undervalued right now.
The indicator‚Äôs value is calculated by taking the difference between the asset‚Äôs market cap and realized cap and dividing it by the standard deviation of the market cap.
Here, the ‚Äúrealized cap‚Äù is a model that calculates the total value of a cryptocurrency by assuming that the real value of any coin in circulation is not the ‚Ä¶

entry.title: South Korean Crypto Exchanges Unveil System for Checking Market Volatility
entry.summary: A group of South Korea‚Äôs major cryptocurrency exchanges has launched a system that alerts users of abnormal changes in the prices of cryptocurrencies. The alliance, dubbed the Digital Asset Exchange Association (DAXA) and comprising Upbit, Bithumb, Coinone, Korbit, and Gopax, said the new system will prevent information asymmetry. DAXA explained that the system sends notifications to users when the prices of cryptocurrencies suddenly rise or fall within a day. Additionally, the system notifies users whenever there is a sharp increase or decrease in the daily trading volumes or deposits, The Korean Times reported. DAXA‚Äôs Standards for Exchanges The latest development follows DAXA‚Äôs announcement of the ethical standards for its members last month. The standards: the DAXA In‚Ä¶

entry.title: Latest Thai Securities Guidelines Require Digital Asset Platforms to Issue Crypto Trading Risk Warnings
entry.summary:
According to Thailand‚Äôs securities regulator, digital asset service providers will be required to warn prospective investors of the risks that come with trading or investing in cryptocurrencies. The guidelines also state that starting on Aug. 30, 2023, digital asset business operators will be barred from ‚Äúproviding services or supporting deposit-taking [and] lending services.‚Äù
The Crypto Risk Warning
Thailand‚Äôs Securities and Exchange Commission has announced new guidelines that require digital asset service providers to warn of ‚Äúpotential risks associated with trading cryptocurrencies.‚Äù According to the securities regulator, all regulated digital asset platforms are to supposed to start displaying this warning on July 31.
In its July 3 statement, the securities regulator added that the message must not only be visible but must ensure prospective investors fully understand the risks involved.
‚ÄúCryptocurrencies are high-risk. Please study and understand the risks of cryptocurrencies thoroughly. because you may lose the entire amount invested,‚Äù the latest Thai SEC guidelines state.
In addition to disclosing the potential risks, the guidelines state that starting Aug. 30 digital asset business operators will be barred from ‚Äúproviding services or supporting deposit-taking [and] lending services.‚Äù This means the Thai crypto industry participants will not be allowed to offer interest on deposits or lend user funds.
Similarly, the advertisement or marketing of crypto assets encouraging the general public to ‚Äúact in the manner of supporting the deposit-taking [and] lending service,‚Äù will be prohibited.
The release of the latest guidelines by the securities regulator comes less than a year after the SEC approved a requirement stipulating that digital assets service providers are obliged to warn prospective investors of the risks involved.
What are your thoughts on this story? Let us know what you think in the comments section below.

entry.title: Bitget Steps into Cryptocurrency Lending with Dual-Coin Approach
entry.summary: The cryptocurrency trading platform, Bitget, has launched a new product 'Crypto Loans' in response to the growing demand for digital lending solutions. This venture is expected to appeal to those users who have been discouraged by the credit offerings of traditional banks. Bitget Answers the Crypto Lending Boom Bitget's Crypto Loans product adopts a dual-coin strategy, where users stake one cryptocurrency from their holdings as collateral to borrow an equivalent amount in another digital asset. The loan is issued at a specific interest rate, with the borrowed sum dictated by the market value of the pledged collateral. Users have the flexibility to repay their loans either before or at the determined deadline. Digital lending, particularly in the crypto domain, has s‚Ä¶

During a Twitter Space event, Davies passionately expressed his belief in ‚Äúkarma‚Äù driving him to make amends and outlined their novel plan to contribute to creditor recoveries through the proceeds generated by OPNX.¬†
As they navigate this uncharted territory, Davies and Zhu strive to turn a new leaf and provide a glimmer of hope for those who were once left in financial turmoil.

entry.title: How Ava Labs Is Approaching Gaming on Avalanche
entry.summary: At 3XP, Ava Labs Head of Gaming Ed Chang sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss some of the biggest Avalanche-based games on the horizon and how the company is approaching and thinking about Web3 gaming.

entry.title: Ogimi Founder David Gull on Why AI Should Be Your Meditation Coach
entry.summary: Ogimi founder David Gull speaks with Decrypt's Jason Nelson about its AI-driven meditation guides and how the technology can enable a more unique, custom-tailored meditation experience for users.

entry.title: VaynerSports Gaming VP Discusses Web3 Content Creators, Decentralized Streaming
entry.summary: Darren Glover, VP of Gaming at talent management agency VaynerSports, sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss the challenges faced by Web3-centric content creators, the current state of the esports market, and how decentralized streaming platforms can challenge centralized leaders like Twitch.

entry.title: NYXL Co-Founder on the State of Esports and Crypto Gaming
entry.summary: Rohit Gupta, co-founder of esports team NYXL, chats with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss challenges faced by the esports industry and opportunities and experiments in Web3.

entry.title: What Is GameBridge? Inside Shrapnel's Gaming Innovation
entry.summary: Marc Mercuri, Head of Platform for Web3 shooter Shrapnel, speaks with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo about GameBridge, a feature that simplifies blockchain item composability and interoperability.

entry.title: Gods Unchained Executive Producer Discusses Epic Games Store Move
entry.summary: Daniel Paez, Executive Producer on Immutable X-based card-battler Gods Unchained, discusses the long-running NFT game's launch on the Epic Games Store and the opportunity it provides.

entry.title: 'Play-to-Earn Is Not Dead. It Will Never Die' Says Words with Friends Creator Paul Bettner
entry.summary: Words With Friends and Wildcard Creator Paul Bettner tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his perspective on Axie Infinity and Web3 games.

entry.title: Cross the Ages Game Review: A Tough But Rewarding Card Battler
entry.summary: Cross the Ages is a digital collectible card game that challenges players to duel online opponents‚Äîand you can even mint your cards as tradable NFTs. It's complex and difficult to grasp at first, but this mobile-first game has some serious strategic upside. GG contributor Ryan Gladwin puts Cross the Ages through its paces.

entry.title: "AI Is Game-Changing But Needs Fact-Checking": AlchemyAI Project Lead
entry.summary: In this interview, Decrypt's Jason Nelson chats with Alchemy product manager and AlchemyAI project lead Elan Halpern on blockchain analysis using ChatGPT, what AI means for better user experience, and the need to fact-check AI. Halpern also gives a demo of the new AlchemyAI ChatGPT plugin.

entry.title: Fractal Is Like an Arcade, Says Twitch Co-Founder Justin Kan
entry.summary: Justin Kan was a co-founder of Twitch and now works on Fractal, a Web3 gaming startup. Kan tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his new company and what he's up to.

entry.title: Are NFTs the Next SEC Target?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin discusses the current regulatory climate in the U.S. with Gala Games' President of Blockchain Jason Brink.

entry.title: Collab.Land Co-Founder Said There Was No ‚ÄòAha Moment‚Äô When Launching DAO Toolkit
entry.summary: CCO and co-founder of Collab.Land Anjali Young explained at this year‚Äôs NFC Lisbon the origins of the crypto community tool kit, which industry niches are turning to its suite of products, and what‚Äôs next for the project since its token distribution event last February.

entry.title: Buying a Slice of H.R. Giger's 'Alien' Is Fine Art, Not Memorabilia: Particle CEO
entry.summary: With H.R. Giger's original "Alien" statue on full display at this year's NFC Lisbon, Particle CEO Harold Eytan told Decrypt that owning an NFT-ified slice of the piece isn't just for fans of the iconic creature and movie series but also for fine art collectors. Interested in owning a piece? Be prepared to cough up half an ETH for one of the 500 tranches of the digitized sculpture.

entry.title: Community Co-Creation 'Is a Big Step for Fashion Brands' Entering the Metaverse: BNV Founder and CEO
entry.summary: The founder and CEO of metaverse fashion platform BNV Richard Hobbs said big brands are still nervous to let fans and community members customize their favorite garments. Still, he believes that as long as you can meet a firm's commercial bottom lines while stirring engagement, there's nothing to lose.

entry.title: Standard Crypto VC Co-Founder on NFTs and Their Stigma in Gaming
entry.summary: Alok Vasudev is a co-founder of venture capital firm Standard Crypto. In an interview with Decrypt's Kate Irwin, he shares his thoughts on NFT marketing, NFT utility in gaming, and the stigma that pervades the industry.
